title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

items.title: Zip Up, Clip In, Copilot On

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Jo discovers how Copilot Groups can make route planning easier. The short video highlights the power of Microsoft Copilot in simplifying planning tasks.
bullets: Route planning made easy, per the description
Focus on Copilot Groups as the key feature
Centered on Microsoft Copilot and AI assistance
Highlights a user (Jo) discovering the feature
takeaways: If route planning is part of your operations, Copilot Groups could simplify planning workflows and reduce coordination overhead.
Copilot Groups may support collaborative planning across teams responsible for grid or data center field work.
AI-assisted route planning could shorten planning time and help streamline maintenance or logistics tasks.
Decision-makers should consider evaluating Copilot Groups for operational scenarios that involve routing and team coordination.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description… The KPMG ON AIR podcast with Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska explains how AI tools are already embedded in audit workflows—supporting repetitive tasks, full-population data analysis and client communication via platforms like KPMG Clara and Clara AI. The episode also covers how these technologies change auditors' roles, required competencies, and raises points about data security, regulation and potential risks.
bullets: AI Transaction Scoring Tool enables analysis of entire populations rather than sampling.
Clara AI offers conversational assistance and specialized agents to support audit tasks.
KPMG Clara platform provides real-time audit management; Clara for Clients modernizes client communication.
AI supports documentation and disclosure analysis, freeing auditors from repetitive tasks.
Speakers address implementation challenges, data security/regulatory issues and potential AI-related risks.
takeaways: Expect audits to increasingly use full-population analytics—ensure your systems provide reliable, accessible data for comprehensive review.
Real-time audit platforms mean more continuous interaction with auditors—prepare for more frequent data sharing and responsiveness.
Data security and regulatory compliance remain critical as AI tools are adopted—prioritize controls, logging and governance for audit readiness.
Automation of repetitive audit tasks can free internal teams for higher-value work, so plan workforce upskilling and role adjustments accordingly.
Evaluate vendor platforms and AI assistants for security, integration and oversight to mitigate potential AI-related risks highlighted in the discussion.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield | 4K NVIDIA DLSS 4 Launch Trailer

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Arknights: Endfield has officially launched and the NVIDIA GeForce trailer highlights support for NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation. The trailer was captured on a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra settings using DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode and presents the game as a 3D real-time strategy RPG set on Talos-II.
bullets: Official launch of Arknights: Endfield, a 3D real-time strategy RPG.
Trailer spotlights NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation.
Capture details: GeForce RTX 5080, 4K Ultra settings, DLSS 4 MFG 4X Mode.
Game premise: play as the Endministrator of Endfield Industries on Talos-II.
Links provided for the game and social channels; no transcript available.
takeaways: Demonstrates DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation being used in a 4K real-time rendering scenario—useful when assessing GPU capabilities for high-fidelity visualization workloads.
Capture on an RTX 5080 highlights the class of client GPUs used for showcasing next-gen upscaling features—relevant for procurement planning of high-performance desktop/workstation hardware.
Trailer confirms developer support for DLSS 4 integration, which may affect software compatibility considerations for NVIDIA-accelerated rendering pipelines.
